channel.title: More Ram Less Lag?
channel.description: ok well i hade 256mb ram im my server than some guy seaid if i get more ram my game wont lag is this ture os is there other fixes

item.title: More Ram Less Lag?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

No, it’s the way the server processes data: It goes sequentially through every player, one at a time.

It should be processing every player at the same time in different threads.

Read full topic

jesus crist lagg is sometimes caused by packet loss when hosting a game google it !!! lol

item.title: More Ram Less Lag?
item.dc:creator: @Leumas Leumas
item.description:
@Leumas wrote:

[quote=“gunztheduel, post:13, topic:68584”]its kind of sad that ur tricking dese guys into buying RAM… and u dont get anything from it too…

size=7pt>It doesn’t matter how strong you are if you can’t hit your target<(’.’<)[/size]

size=7pt>It’s all about speed<(’.’<)[/size][/quote]
Will you stop making it out like you’re right, and NOTHING anyone else says is right?

A 1,5 MB connection IS ABSOLUTLEY FINE to play MoparScape on, and even host games.

I USED to have a 1Mb connection, and was able to host CounterStrike: Source, AND play in the server, WITH about 5 friends, with minimal lag.

Now, my friend… CSS is MUCH more in need of a better internet connection, and if i can host a server, and play in it with friends, then there’s not going to be any problem hosting a server that’s has such low requirments as MoparScape.

256Mb of RAM is way, way too low for nearly anything. Literally, the other day, my friend was told by a computer specialist to upgrade to 1Gb+ RAM, because he also had 256mb, and refused to listen to me, because of someone else who ALSO thought they knew everything.

No doubt, there will be some lag due to the connection, but HIS lag, was from the low RAM aspect.

Sam.

Read full topic

item.title: More Ram Less Lag?
item.dc:creator: @Leumas Leumas
item.description:
@Leumas wrote:

[quote=“gunztheduel, post:9, topic:68584”][quote author=Leumas link=topic=100495.msg1028673#msg1028673 date=1174345984]
Sorry guys, but you are totally wrong.

Going from 256Mb of RAM (Pretty low, no offence), to a much needed upgrade (1gb - 2gb of RAM), he would see a HUGE difference to the amount of lag.

Also, what you said about his connection is also total rubbish.

A connection of 1,5Mb is plenty to play MoparScape, which is effectivly RuneScape.

I can’t find it on their website at the moment, but i’m almost positive there used to be a minimum requirments page.

On there, if I remember correctly, they recommended 512mb - He has 3x that.

So, Bitty3, I suggest you go buy some new RAM.

If you’re in the UK, i suggest www.ebuyer.co.uk (If hyperlinks / advertisement is not allowed, I apologise. :))

Hope I cleared that up for you.

Sam
[/quote]

That’s a load of trash. I have a computer with 1GB ram and I always lag. Sometimes I cannot even connect to the server.

size=7pt>It doesn’t matter how strong you are if you can’t hit your target<(’.’<)[/size]

size=7pt>It’s all about speed<(’.’<)[/size][/quote]

No, no it’s not.

If you had any decent knowledge of computer’s, and how they work, you’d know that how well a java game runs, or, actaully, near-enough any game, depends on how much RAM is availble.

There’s more too it than that, but there’s no need to go into the technical details.

Bitty3 - You were getting lag on that system? Hmm, then if you had a lot of people playing in the server, it was probably the server.

Now, don’t be posting back, gunz, saying “TOLD YOU IT WAS THAT LOL!”, because i was clearing up the more RAM = less lag issue.

Cheers,

Sam

Read full topic
